Grouping Variables in Dilution Table

Source: vignettes/grouping.Rmd
grouping.Rmd

Here is an example when the Dilution Batch and Transitions (Lipids) are not sorted in alphabetical order.

library(DCVtestkit)
# Data Creation
dilution_percent <- c(10, 20, 25, 40, 50, 60,
                      75, 80, 100, 125, 150,
                      10, 25, 40, 50, 60,
                      75, 80, 100, 125, 150)
dilution_batch <- c("B2", "B2", "B2", "B2", "B2",
                    "B2", "B2", "B2", "B2", "B2", "B2",
                    "B1", "B1", "B1", "B1", "B1",
                    "B1", "B1", "B1", "B1", "B1")
sample_name <- c("Sample_010a", "Sample_020a", "Sample_025a",
                 "Sample_040a", "Sample_050a", "Sample_060a",
                 "Sample_075a", "Sample_080a", "Sample_100a",
                 "Sample_125a", "Sample_150a",
                 "Sample_010a", "Sample_025a",
                 "Sample_040a", "Sample_050a", "Sample_060a",
                 "Sample_075a", "Sample_080a", "Sample_100a",
                 "Sample_125a", "Sample_150a")
lipid4_area_saturated <- c(5748124, 16616414, 21702718, 36191617,
                           49324541, 55618266, 66947588, 74964771,
                           75438063, 91770737, 94692060,
                           5192648, 16594991, 32507833, 46499896,
                           55388856, 62505210, 62778078, 72158161,
                           78044338, 86158414)
lipid3_area_linear <- c(31538, 53709, 69990, 101977, 146436, 180960,
                        232881, 283780, 298289, 344519, 430432,
                        25463, 63387, 90624, 131274, 138069,
                        205353, 202407, 260205, 292257, 367924)
lipid2_area_lod <- c(544, 397, 829, 1437, 1808, 2231,
                     3343, 2915, 5268, 8031, 11045,
                     500, 903, 1267, 2031, 2100,
                     3563, 4500, 5300, 8500, 10430)
lipid1_area_nonlinear <- c(380519, 485372, 478770, 474467, 531640, 576301,
                           501068, 550201, 515110, 499543, 474745,
                           197417, 322846, 478398, 423174, 418577,
                           426089, 413292, 450190, 415309, 457618)

dilution_annot <- tibble::tibble(Sample_Name = sample_name,
                                 Dilution_Batch = dilution_batch,
                                 Dilution_Percent = dilution_percent)
lipid_data <- tibble::tibble(Sample_Name = sample_name,
                             Lipid4 = lipid4_area_saturated,
                             Lipid3 = lipid3_area_linear,
                             Lipid2 = lipid2_area_lod,
                             Lipid1 = lipid1_area_nonlinear)

Order of the Dilution_Batch and Transition_Name grouping variables is maintained when summarise_dilution_table is used. No sorting is involved.

# Create dilution table and dilution statistical summary
dilution_summary <- create_dilution_table(dilution_annot, lipid_data,
                                          common_column = "Sample_Name",
                                          signal_var = "Area",
                                          column_group = "Transition_Name"
                                        ) %>%
  summarise_dilution_table(grouping_variable = c("Dilution_Batch",
                                                 "Transition_Name"),
                           conc_var = "Dilution_Percent",
                           signal_var = "Area")
  
print(dilution_summary, width = 100)
#> # A tibble: 8 x 9
#>   Dilution_Batch Transition_Name r_corr r2_linear r2_adj_linear mandel_stats
#>   <chr>          <chr>            <dbl>     <dbl>         <dbl>        <dbl>
#> 1 B2             Lipid4           0.952     0.906        0.901         62.5 
#> 2 B2             Lipid3           0.978     0.957        0.954          1.19
#> 3 B2             Lipid2           0.971     0.942        0.939         84.6 
#> 4 B2             Lipid1           0.344     0.118        0.0718         5.11
#> 5 B1             Lipid4           0.949     0.9          0.894         57.0 
#> 6 B1             Lipid3           0.976     0.953        0.951          1.10
#> 7 B1             Lipid2           0.969     0.940        0.936         82.2 
#> 8 B1             Lipid1           0.384     0.147        0.0997         6.77
#>   mandel_p_val pra_linear concavity
#>          <dbl>      <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1 0.000000290        65.8 -4134.   
#> 2 0.290              90.2    -3.35 
#> 3 0.0000000320       72.9     0.394
#> 4 0.0363           -233.    -19.9  
#> 5 0.000000792        64.6 -4147.   
#> 6 0.308              90.0    -3.39 
#> 7 0.0000000637       72.4     0.401
#> 8 0.0186           -172.    -22.6

grouping variable in evaluate_linearity only put these variables to the front

dilution_classified <- evaluate_linearity(dilution_summary,
                                          grouping_variable = c("Dilution_Batch",
                                                                "Transition_Name"))
print(dilution_classified, width = 100)
#> # A tibble: 8 x 11
#>   Dilution_Batch Transition_Name wf1_group      wf2_group      r_corr pra_linear
#>   <chr>          <chr>           <chr>          <chr>           <dbl>      <dbl>
#> 1 B2             Lipid4          Poor Linearity Saturation      0.952       65.8
#> 2 B2             Lipid3          Good Linearity Good Linearity  0.978       90.2
#> 3 B2             Lipid2          Poor Linearity LOD             0.971       72.9
#> 4 B2             Lipid1          Poor Linearity Poor Linearity  0.344     -233. 
#> 5 B1             Lipid4          Poor Linearity Saturation      0.949       64.6
#> 6 B1             Lipid3          Good Linearity Good Linearity  0.976       90.0
#> 7 B1             Lipid2          Poor Linearity LOD             0.969       72.4
#> 8 B1             Lipid1          Poor Linearity Poor Linearity  0.384     -172. 
#>   mandel_p_val concavity r2_linear r2_adj_linear mandel_stats
#>          <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>         <dbl>        <dbl>
#> 1 0.000000290  -4134.        0.906        0.901         62.5 
#> 2 0.290           -3.35      0.957        0.954          1.19
#> 3 0.0000000320     0.394     0.942        0.939         84.6 
#> 4 0.0363         -19.9       0.118        0.0718         5.11
#> 5 0.000000792  -4147.        0.9          0.894         57.0 
#> 6 0.308           -3.39      0.953        0.951          1.10
#> 7 0.0000000637     0.401     0.940        0.936         82.2 
#> 8 0.0186         -22.6       0.147        0.0997         6.77
